CONCLUSION: Violations of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the town of ORG , GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings for compensation in ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) against a private company , PERSON , for selling her a defective television set .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transferred to the Kamenka - Dniprovskiy Local Court ( “ the Kamenka - Dniprovskiy Court ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the latter court found against the applicant . On DATE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) quashed that judgment and remitted the case to the first - instance court for fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG found for the applicant . On DATE ORG quashed that judgment and remitted the case to ORG for fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE , following a decision by the President of ORG , the case was transferred to ORG ( “ the LOC ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transferred to ORG , which , in a hearing on DATE , left the applicant 's claim unexamined . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE and remitted the case to the Kamenka - Dniprovsky Court for fresh consideration .

CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transferred to ORG , which on DATE left the applicant 's claim unexamined . On DATE ORG quashed that decision and remitted the case for fresh consideration to the same court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG left the applicant 's claim unexamined . On DATE ORG upheld that decision . On DATE ORG quashed the decisions of the lower courts and remitted the case for fresh consideration to the first - instance court .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant 's claim in part , awarding her CARDINAL NORP hryvnias ( ORG ) in compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that judgment with minor amendments .
CARDINAL . The applicant did not appeal in cassation to ORG .
CARDINAL . In DATE insolvency proceedings were initiated against the defendant company .
CARDINAL . The judgment of CARDINAL DATE remains unenforced .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG ( ORG виконавчої служби міського управління юстиції в PERSON області – “ the Bailiffs ' Department ” ) initiated enforcement proceedings in respect of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG did not enforce the judgment and the applicant complained to ORG , which , by judgments of CARDINAL January , DATE and DATE and DATE , found ORG liable for the failure to enforce the judgment of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . Following the reorganisation of the ORG mechanism for enforcing judgments , ORG Departments were closed down without legal successors . ORG were created as the new enforcement bodies ( see Relevant Domestic Law below ) .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against the newly created ORG ( Державна виконавча служба у м. Енергодар – “ the Bailiffs ' Service ” ) in ORG , seeking compensation for the damage caused as a result of the failure to enforce the judgment . On DATE the court ordered that ORG , which no longer performed any functions but remained in the ORG register of legal entities , should be joined as a co - defendant in the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicant 's claims in part and awarded her UAH CARDINAL in compensation for non - pecuniary damage caused by the non - enforcement of the judgment , to be paid by ORG . It dismissed all her claims against the newly created ORG as it had not been found liable for the non - enforcement of the judgment in the applicant 's favour .
CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG was finally liquidated and removed from the ORG register of legal entities .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined the applicant 's appeal and found that the first - instance court had made a correct assessment of the legal relationship between the parties . It further quashed the judgment in the part awarding the applicant LAW against ORG and nullified the proceedings in this part on the ground that ORG had been liquidated without a legal successor .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected a request by the applicant for leave to appeal in cassation .
CARDINAL . The relevant provision of the LAW provides as follows :
Article CARDINAL
“ ... Everyone is guaranteed the right to challenge in court the decisions , actions or omissions of bodies of ORG power , bodies of local self - government , officials and officers ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW provide as follows
LAW Grounds for nullification of the proceedings
“ CARDINAL . A court shall , by its ruling , nullify the proceedings , if :
CARDINAL ) a legal person that was a party to the proceedings has been liquidated . ”

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG was restructured under Decree No . CARDINAL of ORG of DATE and the Act of ORG of DATE “ on introducing amendments to ORG and LAW ” . The above government decree specified that new bailiffs ' services were to be created in place of the bailiffs ' departments of ORG .

CARDINAL . In implementing this restructuring , ORG issued Order No CARDINAL of DATE , and this was followed by orders of the regional departments of justice . ORG of Justice issued such an order on DATE ( Order No . CARDINAL ) . Under the orders the bailiffs ' departments were liquidated without legal successors and the new bailiffs ' services were created in their stead as new legal persons .
